body.p: The Board also redeliberated the transition requirements for entities accounting for an interest in a joint operation in its separate financial statements when the entity had previously accounted for this interest at cost or in accordance with IFRS 9. As stated in paragraph BC38, the Board observed that the parties’ interests in a joint operation are recognised in their separate financial statements, resulting in no difference between what is recognised in the parties’ separate financial statements and in the parties’ consolidated financial statements. The Board decided that an entity should adjust any difference between the investment derecognised and the assets and liabilities recognised in respect of the entity’s interest in a joint operation against retained earnings at the beginning of the earliest period presented.
